description.content: In this lesson we will practise making simple statements about objects, regarding what they basically are. We will also consider using pronouns to refer to objects closer to us than the listener (ie. "This book" etc), and those closer to the listener ("That book" etc). Finally, we will also consider the use of "も" as in "also". The main forms to be practised in this lesson can be summarized by the following examples.

b.u: Grammar Point 1: Use of the -です to explain who or what someone/something is.

p.font: です can be tranlated as "is, are, am" etc. Desu acts like a verb, in that it's form changes depending on the tense, politeness, and sign of the sentence. In this lesson we will only be dealing with the polite, non-past form of Desu. However, the following table shows the various forms of desu, and whilst this information is not required for this lesson, it may be usefull to become familiar with it now.

td.font: ではありませんでした

p.font: Having seen the form that "です" takes, we will now consider it's use and positioning in a sentence. Consider the following examples:

tr.td: "それはりんごではありません"

grammar_points.p: - Desu, in whatever form, is used at the end of the sentence.
- In the above sentences, は is used as the topic marker, ie. the object that we are talking about.
- それ and これ are both pronouns, meaning "That" and "This" respecitively. See the next section for more information.
- In the last example, we can see that to form a question we simply add か to the end of the sentence.

u.b: Grammar Point 2: は and も

grammar_points.p: は is used to mark the subject of a sentence, and follows directly after the subject. For example:
これはリンゴです - "This is an apple"
In this case, "This" is the subject of the sentence.
も is used in the sense of "also", and may also be placed after the subject, replacing は. For example:
これもリンゴです - "This is also an apple"
In this case, "This" is still the subject of the sentence, but the meaning now implies "also", as in that there is another object that the subject is being equated to.
